column3: A remark generally hurts in proportion to its truth.
Purity is the feminine, truth the masculine of honor.
There's no comfort in the truth, pain is all you'll find.
I speak the truth not so much as I would, but as much as I dare, and I dare a little more as I grow older.
He who does not bellow the truth when he knows the truth makes himself the accomplice of liars and forgers.
The thing you fear most has no power. Your fear of it is what has the power. Facing the truth really will set you free.
Say not, 'I have found the truth,' but rather, 'I have found a truth.'
In the different voice of women lies the truth of an ethic of care, the tie between relationship and responsibility, and the origins of aggression in the failure of connection.
Truth is always a delusion.
If there were only one truth, you couldn't paint a hundred canvases on the same theme.
I have nothing new to teach the world. Truth and Non-violence are as old as the hills. All I have done is to try experiments in both on as vast a scale as I could.

The truth is women use contraception not only as a way to prevent unintended pregnancies, but also to improve their health and the health of their families. Increased access to contraception is directly linked to declines in maternal and infant mortality.

We're not going to have the America that we want until we elect leaders who are going to tell the truth - not most days, but every day.

We've had a major shift in what truth is and where it comes from. We've gone from being God-centered to self-centered, from being objective to being subjective, and from being internal to external.
I do not fear truth. I welcome it. But I wish all of my facts to be in their proper context.

Black America surely faces an existential crisis, but not the one imagined in the condescending news media - of somehow getting non-black America to be more just and generous. The truth is, we've already been through that, and there is nothing left to do. We're out of 'affirmative actions' of all kinds.
